greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. satisfies: x = A( x + A(x)^2 ).
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n), n=1..100.
formula: Let G(x) = Series_Reversion( A(x) ) = x + A(x)^2, then G(x) = G(G(x)) - x^2 = g.f. of A138740.
G.f. satisfies: A(x) = x*G(-A(x)^2/x) where G(x) = 1 + x*G(1-1/G(x))^2 is the g.f. of A212411.
G.f.: A(x)/x is the unique solution to variable A in the infinite system of simultaneous equations starting with:
G.f. satisfies: A(x) = x*exp( Sum_{n>=0} (-1)^(n+1)*[d^n/dx^n A(x)^(2n+2)/x]/(n+1)! ). [_Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 18 2010]
example: Let G(x) = Series_Reversion( A(x) ) = x + A(x)^2, then:
so that G(x) = G(G(x)) - x^2 = g.f. of A138740.
mathematica: Do[A[x_] = Sum[a[k] x^k, {k, 0, n}] /. sol; eq = CoefficientList[x - A[x + A[x]^2] + O[x]^(n+1), x][[nmin;;]] == 0 /. sol; sol = sol ~Join~ Solve[eq][[1]], {n, nmin, nmax}];
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Apr 30 2008, May 20 2008
